entry.title: Mentorship Opportunity: Build the Future of KubeStellar Onboarding
entry.content:
Opportunity Summary​

This LFX Mentorship project focuses on KubeStellar Documentation and Self-Service Enablement—creating a frictionless path for new users to adopt KubeStellar.

Timeline​

LFX Mentorship 2026 Term 1 (March–May) — 12 weeks

  • Weeks 1–2: Audit deployments and document friction points
  • Weeks 3–4: Draft Quickstart + run first user tests
  • Weeks 5–6: Build and publish interactive Killercoda tutorial
  • Weeks 7–8: Produce and publish a 5–7 module video series
  • Weeks 9–10: Create a 20-issue troubleshooting guide
  • Weeks 11–12: Deliver use-case docs + migration guides

What You’ll Build​

Deliverables include:

  • A ≤ 30-minute Quickstart
  • A hands-on interactive tutorial (Killercoda)
  • A video series (beginner → advanced)
  • A troubleshooting guide with error signatures and fixes
  • Use-case patterns and migration playbooks

Who Should Apply​

This is a strong fit if you enjoy:

  • Turning complex systems into clear learning journeys
  • Writing docs that reduce support load and improve adoption
  • Building tutorials and validation scripts
  • Working in open source communities

How to Apply​

Applications are managed through the LFX Mentorship portal:

https://mentorship.lfx.linuxfoundation.org/

Get Involved​

  • Join the KubeStellar community on CNCF Slack (#kubestellar-dev)
  • Browse issues and discussions on GitHub
  • Try the prototype site and open feedback issues

entry.title: Project Vision: From Zero to Multi-Cluster in 30 Minutes
entry.content:
The Problem​

Multi-cluster Kubernetes is powerful—but onboarding often isn’t.

New users frequently hit friction early:

  • Toolchain mismatches (kubectl/helm/clusteradm/kflex versions)
  • Context confusion (hosting vs WDS vs ITS vs WECs)
  • “It installed, but nothing syncs” (labels/selectors don’t match)
  • Troubleshooting scattered across sources

The result: time-to-first-success balloons from minutes to hours.

The Vision​

Deliver a documentation and self-service experience that feels like:

  • One clear path to success (≤ 30 minutes)
  • Hands-on learning without local setup (Killercoda tutorial)
  • Fast diagnosis when things go wrong (20 common issues + error signatures)
  • Practical patterns users can adopt immediately (use cases + migration guides)

Why KubeStellar​

KubeStellar simplifies multi-cluster operations with:

  • WDS: define workloads and policies once using native Kubernetes objects
  • ITS: inventory + transport (OCM) to clusters
  • WECs: run workloads and report status
  • BindingPolicy: declare what goes where using labels

This makes multi-cluster feel like single-cluster operations—without rewriting your manifests.

What Success Looks Like​

We measure success with outcomes that matter:

  • ≤ 30 minutes to first successful multi-cluster deployment
  • ≥ 4/5 user satisfaction in external testing
  • 8+ new GitHub issues from new users (signal of engagement)
  • 2+ documentation PRs from users (signal of contribution readiness)

Next Steps​

  • Explore the Quickstart Guide
  • See the Interactive Tutorial Preview
  • Use Troubleshooting when blocked
